fields.description:
Volume XML is not migrated to destination NC which results in inability to detach volume from a migrated instance.

To reproduce:
1) run instance 
2) create and attach volume
3) migrate instance
4) try and detach volume from migrated instance
fields.summary: Cannot detach volume from migrated instance

comments.body:
Error:
{code}
Attempt to detach volume:
2016-03-23 11:57:56 DEBUG 000008230 doDescribeInstances | i-f2ac3c08 Extant (running) pub=10.104.3.122 vols=
2016-03-23 11:57:56 DEBUG 000008230 doDescribeInstances | i-c8abe249 Extant (running) pub=10.104.3.124 vols=vol-21adf84d:A
2016-03-23 11:57:57 INFO 000008230 doDetachVolume | i-c8abe249vol-21adf84d detaching volume
2016-03-23 11:57:57 DEBUG 000008230 doDetachVolume | i-c8abe249vol-21adf84d volume detaching (localDev=/dev/vdc force=0)
2016-03-23 11:57:57 ERROR 000008230 file2str | errno: 2 could not stat file /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAKGHGMJEBTKDFDZVM/i-c8abe249/vol-21adf84d-libvirt.xml
2016-03-23 11:57:57 ERROR 000008230 read_vol_xml | i-c8abe249vol-21adf84d failed to read volume XML from /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAKGHGMJEBTKDFDZVM/i-c8abe249/vol-21adf84d-libvirt.xml
2016-03-23 11:57:57 DEBUG 000008230 get_xpath_content | failed to parse XML in '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAKGHGMJEBTKDFDZVM/i-c8abe249/vol-21adf84d-libvirt.xml'
2016-03-23 11:57:57 DEBUG 000008230 cleanup_volume_attachmen | vol-21adf84d attempting to disconnect iscsi target
2016-03-23 11:57:57 DEBUG 000008230 disconnect_iscsi_target | invoking `//usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap //usr/share/eucalyptus/disconnect_iscsitarget.pl /,,,,,,,,iscsi,tgt,,,,,,10.104.10.7,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store1`
2016-03-23 11:57:57 DEBUG 000008230 disconnect_iscsi_target | disconnect script returned: 0, stdout: '', stderr: ''
2016-03-23 11:57:58 DEBUG 000008230 scClientCall | done scOps=UnexportVolume clientrc=0 opFail=0
2016-03-23 11:57:58 DEBUG 000008230 get_iscsi_target | invoking `//usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap //usr/share/eucalyptus/get_iscsitarget.pl /,,,,,,,,iscsi,tgt,,,,,,10.104.10.7,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store1`
2016-03-23 11:57:58 DEBUG 000008230 get_iscsi_target | get storage script returned: 1, stdout: '', stderr: 'Failed to run '/sbin/iscsiadm -m session -R': iscsiadm: No session found.
{code}
Any chance of this making it into 4.2.2?

Content for vol-xyz-libvirt.xml is generated by the connection perl scripts on the NC. In the volume attachment case (non-migration path), NC saves the output from script execution to the appropriate location on the file system. This behavior should be extended to the migration case as well. libvirt xml may contain information specific to the NC and should not be moved from source to destination NC during migration, this is the current behavior and should left as such.

Looks like the file mentioned above was added in 4.1 with EUCA-9930. I have a suspicion that volume detach has been broken for a while :(. [~swathi], does destination node have enough information to generate new vol-XXXXXXX-libvirt.xml file after migration?

[~vasya] yes, execution of the connection scripts produces the contents of libvirt.xml file for a given volume. In the normal volume attachment path, its saved to the disk and also saved to the instance structure. Please refer to the volume attachment logic for the exact code that does it. I think migration should also use the same logic

[~vasya], do you know if the volume is exposed to the guest after the instance has migrated? I suspect that the volume is attached to the NC but may not be correctly setup in the guest. This may not have anything to do with your changes but its probably necessary to verify that the volumes are correctly attached upon migration.

[~swathi], what makes you think that volumes are not correctly set up on destination?
This is instance before and after mingration
{code}
[root@g-05-03 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-f1e28c7b
RESERVATION	r-20815532	000529338052	test
INSTANCE	i-f1e28c7b	emi-7d0d148e	euca-10-111-31-243.eucalyptus.g-05-03.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-75-94.eucalyptus.internal	running	vk	0		m1.small	2016-05-02T22:41:23.835Z	one				monitoring-disabled	10.111.31.243	10.111.75.94			ebs					hvm			sg-d9acbf9d		i386
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-e893e58d	2016-05-02T22:41:23.916Z	true		
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sdd	vol-e5523b81	2016-05-02T22:43:32.554Z	false		
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sdf	vol-0c25d8e1	2016-05-03T16:59:19.650Z	false		
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sde	vol-cc9a238a	2016-05-03T15:50:00.689Z	false		
TAG	instance	i-f1e28c7b	euca:node	10.111.5.73

[root@g-05-03 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-f1e28c7b
RESERVATION	r-20815532	000529338052	test
INSTANCE	i-f1e28c7b	emi-7d0d148e	euca-10-111-31-243.eucalyptus.g-05-03.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-75-94.eucalyptus.internal	running	vk	0		m1.small	2016-05-02T22:41:23.835Z	one				monitoring-disabled	10.111.31.243	10.111.75.94			ebs					hvm			sg-d9acbf9d		i386
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-e893e58d	2016-05-02T22:41:23.916Z	true		
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sdd	vol-e5523b81	2016-05-02T22:43:32.554Z	false		
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sdf	vol-0c25d8e1	2016-05-03T16:59:19.650Z	false		
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sde	vol-cc9a238a	2016-05-03T15:50:00.689Z	false		
TAG	instance	i-f1e28c7b	euca:node	10.111.5.3
{code}
I can read from all attached volumes after migration
{code}
root@euca-10-111-75-94:/home/ubuntu# cat /mount/disk1/label 
This is disk 1
root@euca-10-111-75-94:/home/ubuntu# cat /mount/disk2/label 
This is disk 2
root@euca-10-111-75-94:/home/ubuntu# cat /mount/disk3/label 
This is disk 3
{code}
I have a set up with DAS that you can poke in you have any doubts.

I incorrectly assumed that eucalyptus generated instance libvirt xml is used for launching the instance on the destination node. After further investigation and discussion with [~vasya], it seems that the migration process boots the instance on the destination host in the same state as it was on the source host, i.e. the guest is brought up with all the devices (disks and nics). NC is responsible for prepping the underlying infrastructure for these devices before starting the migration - establishing iscsi connections and persisting metadata to the instance directory in case of volumes. The current issue is due to missing metadata and the code change proposed by [~vasya] should address it. 

Unrelated to this ticket, we might have to do something similar for ensuring that secondary enis in VPC mode are functional and detachable post migration.

Verified. Can detach and reattach volume after migration.
